original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa🔽Dhammānuloma (1), Dukatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (3)🔽3.12. Kilesagocchaka, Kusalattika
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma anuloma  kilesagocchaka kusalattika
translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽In conformity with the ideas, the triplets in the forward order🔽The unprofitable, the root-causeless, the unprofitable, the root-causeless

original: 3.12.1. Kilesaduka, Kusalattika
analyzed: kilesa duka kusala ttika
translated: The unprofitable, the root-causeless, the profitable, the root-causeless

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Cause

original: Nokilesaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nokileso kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: no kilesam kusalam dhammam paṭicca no kilesaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a root-causeless profitable idea as condition there arises a root-causeless profitable idea through the cause condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: In the cause, one; in the object, one; … in the dissociation, one. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: (In the conascence, etc., and in the questions, too, there is one in each case.)

original: Kilesaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kileso akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Nokilesaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nokileso akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: kilesam akusalam dhammam paṭicca kilesaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  no kilesam akusalam dhammam paṭicca no kilesaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With an unprofitable idea that is a corruption as condition there arises an unprofitable idea that is a corruption through the cause condition. … three.🔽With an unprofitable idea that is not a corruption as condition there arises an unprofitable idea that is not a corruption through the cause condition. … three.

original: Kilesaṁ akusalañca nokilesaṁ akusalañca dhammaṁ paṭicca kileso akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: kilesam akusalañca nokilesam akusalañca dhammam paṭicca kilesaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With an unprofitable idea that is a corruption and an unprofitable idea that is not a corruption as condition there arises an unprofitable idea that is a corruption through the cause condition. … three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava (sabbattha nava), avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava sabbattha nava avigate nava
translated: In the cause, nine; in the object, nine; … in the dissociation, nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: Kilesaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kileso akusalo dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—vicikicchaṁ paṭicca vicikicchāsahagato moho, uddhaccaṁ paṭicca uddhaccasahagato moho.🔽Nokilesaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kileso akusalo dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—vicikicchāsahagate uddhaccasahagate khandhe paṭicca vicikicchāsahagato uddhaccasahagato moho.
analyzed: kilesam akusalam dhammam paṭicca kilesaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati na hetu paccayā vicikiccham paṭicca vicikicchā sahagataḥ mohaḥ uddhaccam paṭicca uddhacca sahagataḥ mohaḥ  no kilesam akusalam dhammam paṭicca kilesaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā vicikicchā sahagate uddhacca sahagate khandhe paṭicca vicikicchā sahagataḥ uddhacca sahagataḥ moho
translated: With a defiled, unwholesome state as condition, a defiled, unwholesome state arises through non-root-cause condition: With uncertainty as condition, the uncertainty aggregate of clinging arises. With agitation as condition, the agitation aggregate of clinging arises.🔽With a non-defiled, unwholesome state as condition, a defiled, unwholesome state arises through non-root-cause condition: With the aggregates of clinging associated with uncertainty and agitation as condition, the uncertainty aggregate of clinging and the agitation aggregate of clinging arise.

original: Kilesaṁ akusalañca nokilesaṁ akusalañca dhammaṁ paṭicca kileso akusalo dhammo uppajjati🔽nahetupaccayā—vicikicchāsahagate khandhe ca vicikicchañca paṭicca vicikicchāsahagato🔽moho, uddhaccasahagate khandhe ca uddhaccañca paṭicca uddhaccasahagato moho. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: kilesam akusalañca nokilesam akusalañca dhammam paṭicca kilesaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati 🔽na hetu paccayā vicikicchā sahagate khandhe ca vicikicchañca paṭicca vicikicchā sahagataḥ 🔽mohaḥ uddhacca sahagate khandhe ca uddhaccam ca paṭicca uddhacca sahagataḥ mohaḥ
translated: With a defiled, unwholesome and a non-defiled, unwholesome state as condition, a defiled, unwholesome state arises through non-root-cause condition: With the aggregates of clinging associated with uncertainty and with uncertainty, and with the aggregates of clinging associated with agitation and with agitation as condition, the uncertainty aggregate of clinging and the agitation aggregate of clinging arise. (In brief.)

original: Nahetuyā tīṇi, naadhipatiyā nava, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, navippayutte nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ, sahajātavārādi vitthāretabbo.)
analyzed: na hetuyā tīṇi na adhipatiyā nava na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane nava na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na vippayutte nava saṅkhitta sahajāta vāra ādi vitthāretabbaḥ
translated: With non-cause as condition, three … With non-decisive support as condition, nine … With non-prior co-arisen as condition, nine … With non-consequent co-arisen as condition, nine … With non-requital as condition, nine … With non-kamma as condition, three … With non-result as condition, nine … With non-path as condition, nine. (In brief.)

original: Kileso akusalo dhammo kilesassa akusalassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava (majjhe tīṇi sahajātādhipati), anantare
analyzed: kilesaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ kilesassa akusalassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava majjhe tīṇi sahajāta adhipati anantare
translated: A defiled, unwholesome state is a condition, as a root-cause condition, for a defiled, unwholesome state. (In brief.)🔽With root-cause as condition, three … With object as condition, nine … With decisive support as condition, nine (three in the middle, with co-nascence and decisive support). With proximity as condition, nine … With contiguity as condition, nine … With non-disappearance as condition, nine … With repetition as condition, nine … With kamma as condition, three … With nutriment as condition, three …

original: nava, samanantare nava …pe… upanissaye nava, āsevane nava, kamme tīṇi, āhāre tīṇi,🔽indriye tīṇi, jhāne tīṇi, magge nava, sampayutte nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nokilesaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nokileso abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: nava samanantare nava pe upanissaye nava āsevane nava kamme tīṇi āhāre tīṇi  indriye tīṇi jhāne tīṇi magge nava sampayutte nava pe avigate nava  no kilesam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca no kilesaḥ abyākataḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With faculty as condition, three … With jhāna as condition, three … With path as condition, nine … With association as condition, nine … (In brief.)🔽With non-defilement as condition there is an unwholesome state that is not a root-cause. (In brief.)🔽With root-cause as condition, one … With object as condition, one … With non-disappearance as condition, one … With proximity as condition, one … With contiguity as condition, one … With non-disappearance as condition, one … With repetition as condition, one … With kamma as condition, one … With nutriment as condition, one …

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: With faculty as condition, one … With jhāna as condition, one … With path as condition, one … With association as condition, one … With presence as condition, one … With absence as condition, one … With disappearance as condition, one … With non-disappearance as condition, one … With death as condition, one … With birth as condition, one … With ageing as condition, one … With sickness as condition, one … With sorrow as condition, one … With lamentation as condition, one … With pain as condition, one … With grief as condition, one … With despair as condition, one … With kamma as condition, one … With craving as condition, one … With clinging as condition, one … With becoming as condition, one … With birth as condition, one … With ignorance as

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: (In the section on origination, etc., and in the questions, there is one triad in each case.)

original: 3.12.2. Saṅkilesikaduka, Pañhāvāra
analyzed: saṅkilesika duka pañhāvāra
translated: … The Corrupted Dyad, the Questions

original: Hetu🔽Saṅkilesikaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saṅkilesiko kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: hetu  saṅkilesikam kusalam dhammam paṭicca saṅkilesikaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: Cause🔽A wholesome corrupted consciousness is related to a wholesome corrupted consciousness by way of the cause condition.

original: Asaṅkilesikaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca asaṅkilesiko kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: asaṅkilesikam kusalam dhammam paṭicca asaṅkilesikaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: A wholesome uncorrupted consciousness is related to a wholesome uncorrupted consciousness by way of the cause condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā dve, ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate dve.
analyzed: hetuyā dve ārammaṇe dve pe avigate dve
translated: In the cause condition there are two; in the object condition there are two; … in the non-hindrance condition there are two.

original: Saṅkilesikaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saṅkilesiko akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: saṅkilesikam akusalam dhammam paṭicca saṅkilesikaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: An unwholesome corrupted consciousness is related to an unwholesome corrupted consciousness by way of the cause condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: In the cause condition there is one; in the object condition there is one; … in the non-hindrance condition there is one. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: (In the section on origination, etc., and in the questions, there is one triad in each case.)

original: Saṅkilesikaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saṅkilesiko abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: saṅkilesikam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca saṅkilesikaḥ abyākataḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A neutral corrupted consciousness is related to a neutral corrupted consciousness by way of the cause condition.

original: Asaṅkilesikaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca asaṅkilesiko abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: asaṅkilesikam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca asaṅkilesikaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With an unadulterated indeterminate as condition, an unadulterated indeterminate … (three triplets).

original: Saṅkilesikaṁ abyākatañca asaṅkilesikaṁ abyākatañca dhammaṁ paṭicca saṅkilesiko abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: saṅkilesikam abyākatam ca asaṅkilesikam abyākatam ca dhammam paṭicca saṅkilesikaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an adulterated indeterminate and an unadulterated indeterminate as condition, an adulterated indeterminate … (abbreviated).

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe avigate pañca
translated: In the section on cause there are five; in the section on object there are two; … in the section on non-deprivation there are five.

original: 3.12.3. Saṅkiliṭṭhaduka, Kusalattika🔽3.12.3.1–7. Paṭiccādivāra
analyzed: saṅkiliṭṭhaduka kusalattika
translated: … The Corrupted Pair, the Wholesome Triad🔽…🔽The Section on Condition

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: The Tetrads on Condition

original: Asaṅkiliṭṭhaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca asaṅkiliṭṭho kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: asaṅkiliṭṭham kusalam dhammam paṭicca asaṅkiliṭṭhaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: With a non-corrupted wholesome as condition, a non-corrupted wholesome … (abbreviated).

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on cause there is one; in the section on object there is one; … in the section on non-deprivation there is one. (abbreviated).

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: (In the section on conascence, etc., and in the questions, in each case there is one.)🔽With a corrupted unwholesome as condition, a corrupted unwholesome … (abbreviated).

original: Saṅkiliṭṭhaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saṅkiliṭṭho akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: saṅkiliṭṭham akusalam dhammam paṭicca saṅkiliṭṭhaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: A corrupt, unwholesome, state has a corrupt, unwholesome, state as its root-cause. (Abbreviated.)🔽

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: … with root cause as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽(In the section on origination, too, and in the question section, there is one in each triad.)🔽… associated with defilements …

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)🔽Asaṅkiliṭṭhaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca asaṅkiliṭṭho abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka  asaṅkiliṭṭham abyākatam dhammam paṭicca asaṅkiliṭṭhaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: … wholesome …🔽… with root cause …🔽… with condition being root cause …🔽… with root cause as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽… with object as condition … (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: … with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽… with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽… with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)🔽3.12.4. Kilesasampayuttaduka, Kusalattika
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: … with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽… with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽… with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽… with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)

original: 3.12.4.1–7. Paṭiccādivāra🔽Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: … with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽… with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽… with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽… with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽… with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽… with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽… with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽… with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽… with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽… with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽… with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽… with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽… with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽… with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽… with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽… with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽… with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)

original: Kilesavippayuttaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kilesavippayutto kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: kilesa vippayuttam kusalam dhammam paṭicca kilesa vippayuttaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: … with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽… with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽… with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)🔽… with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: … with non-tail as condition … (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: … with

original: Kilesasampayuttaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kilesasampayutto akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: kilesa sampayuttam akusalam dhammam paṭicca kilesa sampayuttaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: A state that is associated with defilements and is unwholesome … (as in §1, but with the addition of the words “associated with defilements” in the last two sections of the table.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: (In the section on root cause, one result in each section. In the section on object, one result in each section. … In the section on non-hindrance, one result in each section.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: (In the section on conascence, etc., and in the question section, one result in each section.)

original: Kilesavippayuttaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kilesavippayutto abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: kilesa vippayuttam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca kilesa vippayuttaḥ abyākataḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A state that is dissociated from defilements and is indeterminate … (as in §1, but with the addition of the words “dissociated from defilements” in the last two sections of the table.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: (In the section on root cause, one result in each section. In the section on object, one result in each section. … In the section on non-hindrance, one result in each section.)🔽(In the section on conascence, etc., and in the question section, one result in each section.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi pe pañhā vāre pi sabbattha eka
translated: … the pair “defiled and subject to defilements” …🔽… the triad “wholesome” …🔽… the dyad “subject to defilement” …

original: 3.12.5. Saṅkilesasaṅkilesikaduka, Kusalattika
analyzed: saṅkilesa saṅkilesika duka kusala ttika
translated: … the dyad “not subject to defilement” …🔽… the dyad “defiled” …🔽… the dyad “undefiled” …🔽… the dyad “with fetters” …🔽… the dyad “without fetters” …

original: 3.12.5.1–7. Paṭiccādivāra
translated: … the dyad “with effluents” …🔽… the dyad “without effluents” …🔽… the dyad “mixed” …🔽… the dyad “unmixed” …🔽… the dyad “subject to cankers” …🔽… the dyad “not subject to cankers” …🔽… the dyad “included among the cankers” …🔽… the dyad “not included among the cankers” …

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: … the dyad “with taints” …🔽… the dyad “without taints” …🔽… the dyad “mixed with taints” …🔽… the dyad “unmixed with taints” …🔽… the dyad “with contaminants” …🔽… the dyad “without contaminants” …🔽… the dyad “mixed with contaminants” …🔽… the dyad “unmixed with contaminants” …

original: Saṅkilesikañceva no ca kilesaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saṅkilesiko ceva no ca kileso kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: saṅkilesikam ca iva no ca kilesam kusalam dhammam paṭicca saṅkilesikaḥ ca iva no ca kilesaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: … the dyad “with hindrances” …🔽… the dyad “without hindrances” …

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Sahajātavārepi …pe… pañhāvārepi sabbattha ekaṁ.)🔽Kilesañceva saṅkilesikañca akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kileso ceva saṅkilesiko ca akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Saṅkilesikañceva no ca kilesaṁ akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saṅkilesiko ceva no ca kileso akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Kilesañceva saṅkilesikaṁ akusalañca saṅkilesikañceva no ca kilesaṁ akusalañca dhammaṁ paṭicca kileso ceva saṅkilesiko ca akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. analyzed: dhammam paṭicca kilesaḥ ca iva kilesa sampayuttaḥ ca akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With mentality-materiality as condition, a defilement and that which is associated with it are produced. An unwholesome state.

original: … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: tīṇi

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava …pe… avigate nava.🔽3.12.8. Kilesavippayuttasaṅkilesikaduka, Kusalattika
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava pe avigate nava  kilesa vippayutta saṅkilesika duka kusala ttika
translated: Nine in the cause, nine in the object, etc.🔽…–. The pair: not associated with defilements, but defiling, and wholesome, the triad.

original: 3.12.8.1–7. Paṭiccādivāra
translated: …–. The section on the “with-soruce” method.

original: Paccayacatukka🔽Kilesavippayuttaṁ saṅkilesikaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kilesavippayutto saṅkilesiko kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: paccaya catukka  kilesa vippayuttam saṅkilesikam kusalam dhammam paṭicca kilesa vippayuttaḥ saṅkilesikaḥ kusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: The four sections on conditions.🔽With a wholesome state that is not associated with defilements, but is defiling, as condition, a wholesome state that is not associated with defilements, but is defiling, is produced.

original: Kilesavippayuttaṁ asaṅkilesikaṁ kusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kilesavippayutto asaṅkilesiko kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: kilesa vippayuttam asaṅkilesikam kusalam dhammam paṭicca kilesa vippayuttaḥ asaṅkilesikaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: With a wholesome state that is not associated with defilements, and is not defiling, as condition, a wholesome state that is not associated with defilements, and is not defiling, is produced. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā dve, ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate dve.
analyzed: hetuyā dve ārammaṇe dve pe avigate dve
translated: Two in the cause, two in the object, etc.🔽With an unwholesome state that is not associated with defilements, but is defiling, as condition, an unwholesome state that is not associated with defilements, but is defiling, is produced.

original: Kilesavippayuttaṁ saṅkilesikaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kilesavippayutto saṅkilesiko abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: kilesa vippayuttam saṅkilesikam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca kilesa vippayuttaḥ saṅkilesikaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a non-defiled, defiling, indeterminate state as condition, a non-defiled, defiling, indeterminate state arises, as root-cause condition.

original: Kilesavippayuttaṁ asaṅkilesikaṁ abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kilesavippayutto asaṅkilesiko abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: kilesa vippayuttam asaṅkilesikam abyākatam dhammam paṭicca kilesa vippayuttaḥ asaṅkilesikaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With a non-defiled, non-corrupted, indeterminate state as condition, a non-defiled, non-corrupted, indeterminate state arises, through kamma-result condition … through nutriment condition … through faculty condition … through association condition … through presence condition … through non-disappearance condition.🔽With a non-defiled, non-corrupted, indeterminate and a defiled, corrupted, indeterminate state …

original: Kilesavippayuttaṁ saṅkilesikaṁ abyākatañca kilesavippayuttaṁ asaṅkilesikaṁ abyākatañca
analyzed: kilesa vippayuttam saṅkilesikam abyākatam ca kilesa vippayuttam asaṅkilesikam abyākatam ca
translated: With a non-defiled, non-corrupted, indeterminate and a defiled, corrupted, indeterminate and a non-defiled, non-corrupted, indeterminate state …

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca kilesavippayutto saṅkilesiko abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca kilesa vippayuttaḥ saṅkilesikaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a non-defiled, non-corrupted, indeterminate state as condition, a defiled, corrupted, indeterminate state arises, through kamma-result condition … through nutriment condition … through faculty condition … through association condition … through presence condition … through non-disappearance condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… āsevane ekaṁ …pe… avigate pañca.🔽Kilesagocchakakusalattikaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe āsevane ekam pe avigate pañca 🔽kilesa gocchaka kusala ttikam niṭṭhita
